Class BaseCalcState

  • java.lang.Object
    • BaseCalcState

  • public class BaseCalcState
extends java.lang.Object
    BaseCalcState

    This class contains all the necessary methods to ensure correct calculations of values. It holds two values (value1 and value2) for a simple calculation. It stores the result into an ArrayList for memory usage. opCheck is used as a flag in Calculate(String, int) for the operator keys to determine which operation is required. memNumber is a string variable that is used in displayChange(int) to store the incoming String command in the JSlider event and converts to an int. There are six methods in this class:

    memNumber(String, int) - This method is called whenever a numerical/hex key is pressed. It updates the value variable each time a new numerical/hex key is pressed.

    displayChange(int) - This method is called when the JSlider is moved to change base. It updates the display field accordingly to reflect the change of base.

    Calculate(String, int) - This method is called when an operator key that is NOT equal or Clr is pressed. It flags the corresponding operator for final calculation.

    equal(int) - This method is called when equal is pressed. It conducts the actual calculation based on the operator that was pressed previously.

    clear() - This method is called when Clr is pressed. It sets all variables excluding the result array to 0.

    recallMem(int) - This method is called when Mem is pressed. It will recall the results of previous calculations beginning with the most recent one.

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
